raw_text:
Judge’s One-Page Summary of Proposed Orders
This summary provides the Court with a concise overview of the key differences between the proposed
orders submitted by Brittany Michelle Gilliland and Christopher Blaine McGregor.
Issue Brittany’s Proposals (Docs 55 & 51) Blaine’s Proposal (Doc 53)
Therapist & Costs Mandates Kelly Turner. Costs split 50/50. Mother chooses independent therapist. Mother
Contempt clause against Father. pays all costs. No contempt clause.
CAC Counseling Mother may attend CAC sessions once Father ensures A.K. continues CAC
available. counseling until no longer needed.
Weekly Meals Mandatory Wednesday 6:30 pm dinners with One flexible weekly meal. Default Sunday
make-up if canceled. lunch if no agreement.
Tone Rigid, punitive, escalates conflict. Flexible, cooperative, child-centered.
In summary, Brittany’s proposals impose rigid terms and financial burdens on Father, while Blaine’s
proposal provides a flexible, balanced, and child-focused framework. Father respectfully requests the
Court adopt his proposal.
